page.title: 13Changes in the Alford area
page.content: The most noticable changes have been in farming techniques. The farm labourers'cottages at Well are now the homes for retired couples especially from London. Farms have amalgamated, now growing oilseed rape. The number of privately owned cars has greatly increased;allowing workers to commute to work e.g. in nearby Louth. Leisure time has also tended to increase, although people in the study area were generally dissatisfied with the facilities available. The questionnaire showed that the people were less superstitious and religious, with falling attendances at many churches, especially a decline in the number of families who celebrated Harvest Festival, an indication of the falling importance of agriculture as employment in this area.
